verbs.description: beplaster (third-person singular simple present beplasters, present participle beplastering, simple past and past participle beplastered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To plaster over; to cover or smear thickly; to bedaub (with something).
examples: Yet with talents like these, and an excellent heart,
The man had his failings, a dupe to his art;
Like an ill-judging beauty, his colours he spread,
And beplaister’d with rouge, his own natural red.
